info.name: 3. Distribution REST APIs By Module
info.description:
#### ORACLE Hospitality Distribution Rest APIs

This Postman Collection offers many API call samples for the Oracle Hospitality Distribution REST APIs. For more information on Oracle Distribution visit [Oracle Hospitality Distribution](https://www.oracle.com/au/industries/hospitality/products/hotel-channel-management-software/) .

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
This is required to access the OPERA Cloud Distribution REST APIs.

The username and password for Distribution API are provided by Oracle Hospitality Distribution channel onboarding process, by Oracle, along with your channelCode.

### Obtaining a token

To obtain a token include the following body parameters:

- **username**. set this to your OPERA Cloud Distribution username.
    
- **password**. Set this to your OPERA Cloud Distribution user's password.

item.description:
A valid bearer token is required to access the OPERA Cloud Distribution REST APIs.  
The username and password for Distribution API are provided by Oracle Hospitality Distribution channel onboarding process, by Oracle, along with your channelCode.  

To obtain a token include the following body parameters:  
**username**. set this to your OPERA Cloud Distribution username.  
**password**. Set this to your OPERA Cloud Distribution user's password.

request.description:
This operation allows a channel to retrieve multi-property availability summary with basic information returned.

Channel must send at least one hotel code and stay criteria to see if the properties are available, and what is their minimum and maximum price across all room types.

request.description:
The rateMode value returned might be “**Highest**”. That indicates that if the price is not the same for all nights requested, then the rate amount returned is for example the “Highest” of those dates. If the request is for one night only, then the rateAmount value has no meaning.

The possible values in rateMode are: **Highest**, **Average**, **Arrival** and **MostFrequent**. Default is Highest. You can decide which value you want to see in the response, by using the rateMode parameter in the request message.

response.name: get Properties -> using rate Mode

request.description:
Channel Rate Access Code (RAC) is provided by hotel and should be used to see negotiated rates associated with this RAC in OPERA Cloud.

You can use **alternateOffers** parameter with this request. Applicable if ratePlanCodeMatchOnly flag is false:

- Always - return alternate offers even if requested rate is available.
    
- offersWhenRequestedNotAvailable - Only return alternate rates if requested rates not available
    

Default: Always

request.description:
Get property offers for Public rates

Property Offers provides the ability to request a specific property and get a list of available offers (rate plan codes and room types assigned to channel).

There are several search parameters that can be used to filter the search results.

The response will provide information about the property and each **room type** and **rate plan** individually as well as **offers** for each available room type and rate plan combination.

The offers response will also provide information about booking rules, cancellation, deposit, guarantee policies as well as taxes and total price.

Similar to property Offers, this operation allows to request availability for specific offer. This will return same information as get Property Offers, adding a few more content information.

item.description:
**OPERA Cloud Distribution Shop API.**

The API offers an easy way to connect to properties in order to shop available rates and rooms.

A typical shopping flow starts with Property Search to find available properties in a certain rate range, followed by a Property Offers request to get the available rates and rooms at selected property.  
Finally, a Get Offer request will return all the details needed for a specific offer before user decides to make a booking.

For single property, it is also possible to request availability for specific stay criteria during a specific date range of possible arrival dates (Calendar)

The message types are:  
• Property search -get availability status for multiple properties.  
• Property offers -search available offers at single property  
• Property Get offer -get details on specified property, rate and room  
• Property Calendar -list available offers as a calendar for specified property

item.name: Distribution Book (BOOK)

OPERA Cloud Distribution calculates prices, taxes and set the Cancellation and Deposit policies if applicable.

request.description:
Reservation associated with Travel Agent, Company and Source profiles.

If the corporate ID sent with the Company profile does not exist in OPERA Cloud, the Company will not be created automatically. The reservation will be created without Company profile.

If Travel Agent or Source ID does not exist in OPERA Cloud, then a Travel Agent or Source profile will be created as part of the booking, if at least, a name is also provide for those profiles.

Note: in order for OPERA Cloud to accept a reservation to be associated to both a Travel Agent and a Source profile, an OPERA control needs to be enabled.

request.description:
Create Reservation "In-session", using "isSessionRequest": true.

The reservation will issue a confirmation number, and decrease inventory. However, the reservation will not be saved until a Commit is sent with a second request.

If an Ignore is sent, the "in-session" reservation will be simply deleted and inventory returned back to hotel.

If no Commit or Ignore is sent, the "in-session" will eventually be deleted automatically and inventory returned back to hotel. The time until the reservation is automatically deleted is defined by the property in OPERA Cloud.

item.description:
**OPERA Cloud Distribution Book API.**

The API offers a distribution channel an easy way to book a property.

A typical booking flow starts with Shop requests to find available properties. Once a property offer is identified, the Book requests can be used to create, retrieve, modify and cancel reservations in OPERA Cloud via Distribution APIs.

Book request does not require to pass any price or policy information as those will be calculated by OPERA Cloud during the Book response. Based on availability and applicable policy requirements for a given stay, Book may reject the request in case property, specific offer or type of guarantee is not available.

The Book operations are used in case the booking is created only in OPERA Cloud.

If you are looking for API that will simply allow channel to deliver a reservation already committed to guest in another system, you will prefer OPERA Cloud Distribution Reservation Notification.

Note that same channel code can not use both Book and Reservation Notification. This is channel specific configuration discussed during channel onboarding.

The different operations allow to:  
• Create reservation  
• Modify reservation  
• Retrieve reservation  
• Cancel reservation

Optional:  
• In-session with Commit and Ignore operations. This is used only if channel uses a two-step approach to create, modify or cancel a booking. First an API call is done to create a reservation "in session" which means confirmation number is generated and inventory is hold but reservation will not be saved until an explicit "Commit" request is sent subsquently. "Ignore" can be sent to discard the reservation in session and inventory will be released back to hotel. Same apply for modifications and cancellations. The in-session requests are ideal when orchestrating multiple bookings (shopping cart).

item.description:
**OPERA Cloud Distribution Reservation Notification API.**

The API offers a distribution channel an easy way to deliver a reservation alreayd committed in another system.

Reservation Notification is meant to accept the rates and stay details even if the offer is set as different price or not available in OPERA Cloud. Those reservations being already committed to the guests, they must be delivered to OPERA Cloud.

The different operations allow to:  
• Create reservation  
• Modify reservation  
• Retrieve reservation  
• Cancel reservation

item.description:
Based on your channel code there is two different ways to integrate with OPERA Cloud Distribution APIs.

- **Shop and Book** (Booking engines, Global Distribution Systems,..)
    
    - Used when channel creates booking directly in OPERA Cloud
        
    - Availability is retrieved from OPERA Cloud Distribution
        
    - Reservation requests are accepted or rejected based on dates, rates and guarantee availability. Prices are calculated by OPERA Cloud Distribution in real time.
        
- **ARI Push and Reservation Notification** (Online Travel Agencies, Channel managers,..)
    
    - Used when channel creates booking in their system and simply need to delivery it to OPERA Cloud
        
    - Availability is published to the channel and data is stored in the channel system
        
    - Because the guest already received confirmation from the channel systen, OEPRA Cloud Distribution Reservation Notification accepts rates, guarantee from the channel, even if different or not available in OPERA Cloud Distribution.
